Core Concepts¶

New Logic can be expressed in terms of an API that applies Core Concepts to Domain objects.

analytics.concepts.disagreement.believable_choice_categorical_binary(values_and_weights: List[Tuple[str, float]], minimum_vote: float = 0.7) → Optional[str][source]¶

Disagrees With logic for Categorical/Binary responses.

Parameters:
  • values_and_weights – Strings values and corresponding believability
  • minimum_vote – Believable choice has greater than this quantity of the believability-weighted vote.
Returns:

Believable choice, or None (if there isn’t one).
Return type:

Optional[str]
analytics.concepts.disagreement.believable_choice_numeric(values_and_weights: List[Tuple[float, float]]) → float[source]¶

“Believable Choice” logic for Numeric responses.

Parameters:values_and_weights – Numeric values and corresponding believability.
Returns:Believability-weighted average
Return type:float

analytics.concepts.disagreement.is_polarizing(scale_assertions: src.objects.ScaleValueSet, thresh_on_std_scale: float = 1.0, thresh_on_std_mapped_scale: float = 0.5, thresh_on_poles: float = 0.25) → src.objects.Judgement[source]¶
Parameters:
  • scale_assertions – List of assertions with scale values.
  • thresh_on_std_scale – Threshold on standard deviation of scale values.
  • thresh_on_std_mapped_scale – Threshold on standard deviation of scale values mapped to 1, 2, and 3
  • thresh_on_poles – Threshold on ratio between poles
Returns:

Whether a set of scale values are polarizing.
Return type:

object.Judgement
analytics.concepts.disagreement.substantive_disagreement(scale_values: Tuple[float, float], threshold_high: float = 1.7)[source]¶
Parameters:
  • scale_values – Scale Value Pair
  • threshold_high – Returns False if difference between raw values is less than this quantity.
Returns:

Whether there’s substantive disagreement between two assertions.
Return type:

object.Judgement
